children.name: abhorrest
children.sourceText: For before the child shall know to refuse the evil and choose the good, the land that thou abhorrest shall be forsaken of both her kings.

children.name: abhorreth
children.sourceText: Thus saith the Lord, the Redeemer of Israel, his Holy One, to him whom man despiseth, to him whom the nations abhorreth, to servant of rulers:

children.name: abolish
children.sourceText: And the idols he shall utterly abolish.

children.name: abolished
children.sourceText: But my salvation shall be forever, and my righteousness shall not be abolished.

children.name: Abraham
children.sourceText: Look unto Abraham, your father, and unto Sarah, she that bare you; for I called him alone, and blessed him.

children.name: abundance
children.sourceText: And it shall come to pass in that day, a man shall nourish a young cow and two sheep; And it shall come to pass, for the abundance of milk they shall give he shall eat butter; for butter and honey shall every one eat that is left in the land.

children.name: according
children.sourceText: To the law and to the testimony; and if they speak not according to this word, it is because there is no light in them.

children.name: accounted
children.sourceText: Cease ye from man, whose breath is in his nostrils; for wherein is he to be accounted of?

children.name: acquainted
children.sourceText: He is despised and rejected of men; a man of sorrows, and acquainted with grief; and we hid as it were our faces from him; he was despised, and we esteemed him not.

children.name: acres
children.sourceText: Yea, ten acres of vineyard shall yield one bath, and the seed of a homer shall yield an ephah.

children.name: adversaries
children.sourceText: Therefore the Lord shall set up the adversaries of Rezin against him, and join his enemies together; The Syrians before and the Philistines behind; and they shall devour Israel with open mouth.

children.name: adversary
children.sourceText: Who is mine adversary?

children.name: afflict
children.sourceText: But I will put it into the hand of them that afflict thee; who have said to thy soul:

children.name: afflicted
children.sourceText: Sing, O heavens; and be joyful, O earth; for the feet of those who are in the east shall be established; and break forth into singing, O mountains; for they shall be smitten no more; for the Lord hath comforted his people, and will have mercy upon his afflicted.

children.name: affliction
children.sourceText: For, behold, I have refined thee, I have chosen thee in the furnace of affliction.

children.name: agates
children.sourceText: And I will make thy windows of agates, and thy gates of carbuncles, and all thy borders of pleasant stones.

children.name: Ahaz
children.sourceText: And it came to pass in the days of Ahaz the son of Jotham, the son of Uzziah, king of Judah, that Rezin, king of Syria, and Pekah the son of Remaliah, king of Israel, went up toward Jerusalem to war against it, but could not prevail against it.

children.name: Aiath
children.sourceText: He is come to Aiath, he is passed to Migron; at Michmash he hath laid up his carriages.

children.name: altar
children.sourceText: Then flew one of the seraphim unto me, having a live coal in his hand, which he had taken with the tongs from off the altar; And he laid it upon my mouth, and said:

children.name: am
children.sourceText: Hearken unto me, O Jacob, and Israel my called, for I am he; I am the first, and I am also the last.

children.name: amazed
children.sourceText: Therefore shall all hands be faint, every man's heart shall melt; And they shall be afraid; pangs and sorrows shall take hold of them; they shall be amazed one at another; their faces shall be as flames.

children.name: Ammon
children.sourceText: But they shall fly upon the shoulders of the Philistines towards the west; they shall spoil them of the east together; they shall lay their hand upon Edom and Moab; and the children of Ammon shall obey them.

children.name: Amoz
children.sourceText: The word that Isaiah, the son of Amoz, saw concerning Judah and Jerusalem:

children.name: Anathoth
children.sourceText: Lift up the voice, O daughter of Gallim; cause it to be heard unto Laish, O poor Anathoth.

children.name: ancient
children.sourceText: Put on strength, O arm of the Lord; awake as in the ancient days.

children.name: ancients
children.sourceText: The Lord will enter into judgment with the ancients of his people and the princes thereof; for ye have eaten up the vineyard and the spoil of the poor in your houses.

children.name: anger
children.sourceText: Nevertheless, for my name's sake will I defer mine anger, and for my praise will I refrain from thee, that I cut thee not off.

children.name: anguish
children.sourceText: And they shall look unto the earth and behold trouble, and darkness, dimness of anguish, and shall be driven to darkness.

children.name: anointing
children.sourceText: And it shall come to pass in that day that his burden shall be taken away from off thy shoulder, and his yoke from off thy neck, and the yoke shall be destroyed because of the anointing.

children.name: answer
children.sourceText: Wherefore, when I came, there was no man; when I called, yea, there was none to answer.

children.name: apparel
children.sourceText: In that day the Lord will take away the bravery of their tinkling ornaments, and cauls, and round tires like the moon; The chains and the bracelets, and the mufflers; The bonnets, and the ornaments of the legs, and the headbands, and the tablets, and the ear-rings; The rings, and nose jewels; The changeable suits of apparel, and the mantles, and the wimples, and the crisping-pins; The glasses, and the fine linen, and hoods, and the veils.

children.name: appetite
children.sourceText: And all the nations that fight against Zion, and that distress her, shall be as a dream of a night vision; yea, it shall be unto them, even as unto a hungry man which dreameth, and behold he eateth but he awaketh and his soul is empty; or like unto a thirsty man which dreameth, and behold he drinketh but he awaketh and behold he is faint, and his soul hath appetite; yea, even so shall the multitude of all the nations be that fight against Mount Zion.

children.name: appointed
children.sourceText: Howl, O gate; cry, O city; thou, whole Palestina, art dissolved; for there shall come from the north a smoke, and none shall be alone in his appointed times.

children.name: are
children.sourceText: Hearken and hear this, O house of Jacob, who are called by the name of Israel, and are come forth out of the waters of Judah, or out of the waters of baptism, who swear by the name of the Lord, and make mention of the God of Israel, yet they swear not in truth nor in righteousness.

children.name: arise
children.sourceText: Kings shall see and arise, princes also shall worship, because of the Lord that is faithful.

children.name: ariseth
children.sourceText: And they shall go into the holes of the rocks, and into the caves of the earth, for the fear of the Lord shall come upon them and the glory of his majesty shall smite them, when he ariseth to shake terribly the earth.

children.name: arm
children.sourceText: The Lord hath loved him; yea, and he will fulfil his word which he hath declared by them; and he will do his pleasure on Babylon, and his arm shall come upon the Chaldeans.

children.name: arms
children.sourceText: Behold, I will lift up mine hand to the Gentiles, and set up my standard to the people; and they shall bring thy sons in their arms, and thy daughters shall be carried upon their shoulders.

children.name: Arpad
children.sourceText: Is not Hamath as Arpad?

children.name: arrogancy
children.sourceText: And I will punish the world for evil, and the wicked for their iniquity; I will cause the arrogancy of the proud to cease, and will lay down the haughtiness of the terrible.

children.name: arrows
children.sourceText: None shall slumber nor sleep; neither shall the girdle of their loins be loosed, nor the latchet of their shoes be broken; Whose arrows shall be sharp, and all their bows bent, and their horses' hoofs shall be counted like flint, and their wheels like a whirlwind, their roaring like a lion.

children.name: art
children.sourceText: And I did it because I knew that thou art obstinate, and thy neck is an iron sinew, and thy brow brass; And I have even from the beginning declared to thee; before it came to pass I showed them thee; and I showed them for fear lest thou shouldst say, Mine idol hath done them, and my graven image, and my molten image hath commanded them.

children.name: artificer
children.sourceText: For behold, the Lord, the Lord of Hosts, doth take away from Jerusalem, and from Judah, the stay and the staff, the whole staff of bread, and the whole stay of water; The mighty man, and the man of war, the judge, and the prophet, and the prudent, and the ancient; The captain of fifty, and the honorable man, and the counselor, and the cunning artificer, and the eloquent orator.

children.name: ascend
children.sourceText: I will ascend into heaven, I will exalt my throne above the stars of God; I will sit also upon the mount of the congregation, in the sides of the north; I will ascend above the heights of the clouds; I will be like the Most High.

children.name: ask
children.sourceText: Ask thee a sign of the Lord thy God; ask it either in the depths, or in the heights above.

children.name: asp
children.sourceText: And the sucking child shall play on the hole of the asp, and the weaned child shall put his hand on the cockatrice's den.

children.name: assemble
children.sourceText: All ye, assemble yourselves, and hear; who among them hath declared these things unto them?

children.name: assemblies
children.sourceText: And the Lord will create upon every dwelling-place of mount Zion, and upon her assemblies, a cloud and smoke by day and the shining of a flaming fire by night; for upon all the glory of Zion shall be a defence.

children.name: associate
children.sourceText: Associate yourselves, O ye people, and ye shall be broken in pieces; and give ear all ye of far countries; gird yourselves, and ye shall be broken in pieces; gird yourselves, and ye shall be broken in pieces.

children.name: Assyria
children.sourceText: The Lord shall bring upon thee, and upon thy people, and upon thy father's house, days that have not come from the day that Ephraim departed from Judah, the king of Assyria.

children.name: astray
children.sourceText: O house of Jacob, come ye and let us walk in the light of the Lord; yea, come, for ye have all gone astray, every one to his wicked ways.

children.name: awake
children.sourceText: Awake, awake!

children.name: awaketh
children.sourceText: And all the nations that fight against Zion, and that distress her, shall be as a dream of a night vision; yea, it shall be unto them, even as unto a hungry man which dreameth, and behold he eateth but he awaketh and his soul is empty; or like unto a thirsty man which dreameth, and behold he drinketh but he awaketh and behold he is faint, and his soul hath appetite; yea, even so shall the multitude of all the nations be that fight against Mount Zion.

children.name: ax
children.sourceText: Shall the ax boast itself against him that heweth therewith?

children.name: babes
children.sourceText: And I will give children unto them to be their princes, and babes shall rule over them.

children.name: Babylon
children.sourceText: The Lord hath loved him; yea, and he will fulfil his word which he hath declared by them; and he will do his pleasure on Babylon, and his arm shall come upon the Chaldeans.

children.name: baldness
children.sourceText: And it shall come to pass, instead of sweet smell there shall be stink; and instead of a girdle, a rent; and instead of well set hair, baldness; and instead of a stomacher, a girding of sackcloth; burning instead of beauty.

children.name: bands
children.sourceText: Shake thyself from the dust; arise, sit down, O Jerusalem; loose thyself from the bands of thy neck, O captive daughter of Zion.

children.name: banks
children.sourceText: Forasmuch as this people refuseth the waters of Shiloah that go softly, and rejoice in Rezin and Remaliah's son; Now therefore, behold, the Lord bringeth up upon them the waters of the river, strong and many, even the king of Assyria and all his glory; and he shall come up over all his channels, and go over all his banks.

children.name: banner
children.sourceText: Lift ye up a banner upon the high mountain, exalt the voice unto them, shake the hand, that they may go into the gates of the nobles.

children.name: baptism
children.sourceText: Hearken and hear this, O house of Jacob, who are called by the name of Israel, and are come forth out of the waters of Judah, or out of the waters of baptism, who swear by the name of the Lord, and make mention of the God of Israel, yet they swear not in truth nor in righteousness.

children.name: base
children.sourceText: And the people shall be oppressed, every one by another, and every one by his neighbor; the child shall behave himself proudly against the ancient, and the base against the honorable.

children.name: Bashan
children.sourceText: Yea, and the day of the Lord shall come upon all the cedars of Lebanon, for they are high and lifted up; and upon all the oaks of Bashan; And upon all the high mountains, and upon all the hills, and upon all the nations which are lifted up, and upon every people; And upon every high tower, and upon every fenced wall; And upon all the ships of the sea, and upon all the ships of Tarshish, and upon all pleasant pictures.

children.name: bath
children.sourceText: Yea, ten acres of vineyard shall yield one bath, and the seed of a homer shall yield an ephah.

children.name: bats
children.sourceText: In that day a man shall cast his idols of silver, and his idols of gold, which he hath made for himself to worship, to the moles and to the bats; To go into the clefts of the rocks, and into the tops of the ragged rocks, for the fear of the Lord shall come upon them and the majesty of his glory shall smite them, when he ariseth to shake terribly the earth.

children.name: battle
children.sourceText: For every battle of the warrior is with confused noise, and garments rolled in blood; but this shall be with burning and fuel of fire.

children.name: be
children.sourceText: For mine own sake, yea, for mine own sake will I do this, for I will not suffer my name to be polluted, and I will not give my glory unto another.

children.name: bear
children.sourceText: Therefore, the Lord himself shall give you a sign, Behold, a virgin shall conceive, and shall bear a son, and shall call his name Immanuel.

children.name: beard
children.sourceText: In the same day shall the Lord shave with a razor that is hired, by them beyond the river, by the king of Assyria, the head, and the hair of the feet; and it shall also consume the beard.

children.name: beasts
children.sourceText: But wild beasts of the desert shall lie there; and their houses shall be full of doleful creatures; and owls shall dwell there, and satyrs shall dance there.

children.name: beat
children.sourceText: and they shall beat their swords into plow-shares, and their spears into pruning-hooks, nation shall not lift up sword against nation, neither shall they learn war any more.

children.name: beauty
children.sourceText: And it shall come to pass, instead of sweet smell there shall be stink; and instead of a girdle, a rent; and instead of well set hair, baldness; and instead of a stomacher, a girding of sackcloth; burning instead of beauty.

children.name: become
children.sourceText: With arrows and with bows shall men come thither, because all the land shall become briers and thorns.

children.name: bee
children.sourceText: And it shall come to pass in that day that the Lord shall hiss for the fly that is in the uttermost part of Egypt, and for the bee that is in the land of Assyria.

children.name: been
children.sourceText: O that thou hadst hearkened to my commandments, then had thy peace been as a river, and thy righteousness as the waves of the sea.

children.name: beginning
children.sourceText: Behold, I have declared the former things from the beginning; and they went forth out of my mouth, and I showed them.

children.name: behave
children.sourceText: And the people shall be oppressed, every one by another, and every one by his neighbor; the child shall behave himself proudly against the ancient, and the base against the honorable.

children.name: believe
children.sourceText: If ye will not believe surely ye shall not be established.

children.name: believed
children.sourceText: Who hath believed our report, and to whom is the arm of the Lord revealed?

children.name: bent
children.sourceText: None shall slumber nor sleep; neither shall the girdle of their loins be loosed, nor the latchet of their shoes be broken; Whose arrows shall be sharp, and all their bows bent, and their horses' hoofs shall be counted like flint, and their wheels like a whirlwind, their roaring like a lion.

children.name: besom
children.sourceText: I will also make it a possession for the bittern, and pools of water; and I will sweep it with the besom of destruction, saith the Lord of Hosts.

children.name: bestead
children.sourceText: And they shall pass through it hardly bestead and hungry; and it shall come to pass that when they shall be hungry, they shall fret themselves, and curse their king and their God, and look upward.

children.name: bill
children.sourceText: Where is the bill of your mother's divorcement?

children.name: bind
children.sourceText: And as I live, saith the Lord, thou shalt surely clothe thee with them all, as with an ornament, and bind them on even as a bride.

children.name: bittern
children.sourceText: I will also make it a possession for the bittern, and pools of water; and I will sweep it with the besom of destruction, saith the Lord of Hosts.

children.name: blackness
children.sourceText: I clothe the heavens with blackness, and I make sackcloth their covering.

children.name: blood
children.sourceText: And I will feed them that oppress thee with their own flesh; they shall be drunken with their own blood as with sweet wine; and all flesh shall know that I, the Lord, am thy Savior and thy Redeemer, the Mighty One of Jacob.

children.name: blossoms
children.sourceText: Therefore, as the fire devoureth the stubble, and the flame consumeth the chaff, their root shall be rottenness, and their blossoms shall go up as dust; because they have cast away the law of the Lord of Hosts, and despised the word of the Holy One of Israel.

children.name: bloweth
children.sourceText: Behold, I have created the smith that bloweth the coals in the fire, and that bringeth forth an instrument for his work; and I have created the waster to destroy.

children.name: boast
children.sourceText: Shall the ax boast itself against him that heweth therewith?

children.name: body
children.sourceText: Bow down, that we may go over, and thou hast laid thy body as the ground and as the street to them that went over.

children.name: bondage
children.sourceText: And it shall come to pass in that day that the Lord shall give thee rest, from thy sorrow, and from thy fear, and from the hard bondage wherein thou wast made to serve.

children.name: bonnets
children.sourceText: In that day the Lord will take away the bravery of their tinkling ornaments, and cauls, and round tires like the moon; The chains and the bracelets, and the mufflers; The bonnets, and the ornaments of the legs, and the headbands, and the tablets, and the ear-rings; The rings, and nose jewels; The changeable suits of apparel, and the mantles, and the wimples, and the crisping-pins; The glasses, and the fine linen, and hoods, and the veils.

children.name: book
children.sourceText: And in that day shall the deaf hear the words of the book, and the eyes of the blind shall see out of obscurity and out of darkness.

children.name: borders
children.sourceText: By the strength of my hand and by my wisdom I have done these things; for I am prudent; and I have moved the borders of the people, and have robbed their treasures, and I have put down the inhabitants like a valiant man; And my hand hath found as a nest the riches of the people; and as one gathereth eggs that are left have I gathered all the earth; and there was none that moved the wing, or opened the mouth, or peeped.

children.name: bore
children.sourceText: Therefore will I divide him a portion with the great, and he shall divide the spoil with the strong; because he hath poured out his soul unto death; and he was numbered with the transgressors; and he bore the sins of many, and made intercession for the transgressors.

children.name: born
children.sourceText: For unto us a child is born, unto us a son is given; and the government shall be upon his shoulder; and his name shall be called, Wonderful, Counselor, The Mighty God, The Everlasting Father, The Prince of Peace.

children.name: borne
children.sourceText: Surely he has borne our griefs, and carried our sorrows; yet we did esteem him stricken, smitten of God, and afflicted.

children.name: bough
children.sourceText: Behold, the Lord, the Lord of Hosts shall lop the bough with terror; and the high ones of stature shall be hewn down; and the haughty shall be humbled.

children.name: bow
children.sourceText: And kings shall be thy nursing fathers, and their queens thy nursing mothers; they shall bow down to thee with their face towards the earth, and lick up the dust of thy feet; and thou shalt know that I am the Lord; for they shall not be ashamed that wait for me.

children.name: bowed
children.sourceText: And it shall come to pass that the lofty looks of man shall be humbled, and the haughtiness of men shall be bowed down, and the Lord alone shall be exalted in that day.

children.name: bowels
children.sourceText: Thy seed also had been as the sand; the offspring of thy bowels like the gravel thereof; his name should not have been cut off nor destroyed from before me.

children.name: boweth
children.sourceText: And the mean man boweth not down, and the great man humbleth himself not, therefore, forgive him not.

children.name: bows
children.sourceText: None shall slumber nor sleep; neither shall the girdle of their loins be loosed, nor the latchet of their shoes be broken; Whose arrows shall be sharp, and all their bows bent, and their horses' hoofs shall be counted like flint, and their wheels like a whirlwind, their roaring like a lion.

children.name: bracelets
children.sourceText: In that day the Lord will take away the bravery of their tinkling ornaments, and cauls, and round tires like the moon; The chains and the bracelets, and the mufflers; The bonnets, and the ornaments of the legs, and the headbands, and the tablets, and the ear-rings; The rings, and nose jewels; The changeable suits of apparel, and the mantles, and the wimples, and the crisping-pins; The glasses, and the fine linen, and hoods, and the veils.

children.name: branch
children.sourceText: In that day shall the branch of the Lord be beautiful and glorious; the fruit of the earth excellent and comely to them that are escaped of Israel.

children.name: bravery
children.sourceText: In that day the Lord will take away the bravery of their tinkling ornaments, and cauls, and round tires like the moon; The chains and the bracelets, and the mufflers; The bonnets, and the ornaments of the legs, and the headbands, and the tablets, and the ear-rings; The rings, and nose jewels; The changeable suits of apparel, and the mantles, and the wimples, and the crisping-pins; The glasses, and the fine linen, and hoods, and the veils.

children.name: breach
children.sourceText: Let us go up against Judah and vex it, and let us make a breach therein for us, and set a king in the midst of it, yea, the son of Tabeal.

children.name: bread
children.sourceText: The captive exile hasteneth, that he may be loosed, and that he should not die in the pit, nor that his bread should fail.

children.name: breadth
children.sourceText: And he shall pass through Judah; he shall overflow and go over, he shall reach even to the neck; and the stretching out of his wings shall fill the breadth of thy land, O Immanuel.

children.name: break
children.sourceText: Sing, O heavens; and be joyful, O earth; for the feet of those who are in the east shall be established; and break forth into singing, O mountains; for they shall be smitten no more; for the Lord hath comforted his people, and will have mercy upon his afflicted.

children.name: breath
children.sourceText: Cease ye from man, whose breath is in his nostrils; for wherein is he to be accounted of?

children.name: bricks
children.sourceText: The bricks are fallen down, but we will build with hewn stones; the sycamores are cut down, but we will change them into cedars.

children.name: bride
children.sourceText: And as I live, saith the Lord, thou shalt surely clothe thee with them all, as with an ornament, and bind them on even as a bride.

children.name: briers
children.sourceText: And now go to; I will tell you what I will do to my vineyard; I will take away the hedge thereof, and it shall be eaten up; and I will break down the wall thereof, and it shall be trodden down; And I will lay it waste; it shall not be pruned nor digged; but there shall come up briers and thorns; I will also command the clouds that they rain no rain upon it.

children.name: bring
children.sourceText: And now, saith the Lord, that formed me from the womb that I should be his servant, to bring Jacob again to him, though Israel be not gathered, yet shall I be glorious in the eyes of the Lord, and my God shall be my strength.

children.name: bringeth
children.sourceText: Forasmuch as this people refuseth the waters of Shiloah that go softly, and rejoice in Rezin and Remaliah's son; Now therefore, behold, the Lord bringeth up upon them the waters of the river, strong and many, even the king of Assyria and all his glory; and he shall come up over all his channels, and go over all his banks.

children.name: brother
children.sourceText: When a man shall take hold of his brother of the house of his father, and shall say:

children.name: brought
children.sourceText: Also, saith the Lord; I the Lord, yea, I have spoken; yea, I have called him to declare, I have brought him, and he shall make his way prosperous.

children.name: brow
children.sourceText: And I did it because I knew that thou art obstinate, and thy neck is an iron sinew, and thy brow brass; And I have even from the beginning declared to thee; before it came to pass I showed them thee; and I showed them for fear lest thou shouldst say, Mine idol hath done them, and my graven image, and my molten image hath commanded them.

children.name: bruise
children.sourceText: Yet it pleased the Lord to bruise him; he hath put him to grief; when thou shalt make his soul an offering for sin he shall see his seed, he shall prolong his days, and the pleasure of the Lord shall prosper in his hand.

children.name: bruised
children.sourceText: But he was wounded for our transgressions, he was bruised for our iniquities; the chastisement of our peace was upon him; and with his stripes we are healed.

children.name: build
children.sourceText: The bricks are fallen down, but we will build with hewn stones; the sycamores are cut down, but we will change them into cedars.

children.name: built
children.sourceText: And he fenced it, and gathered out the stones thereof, and planted it with the choicest vine, and built a tower in the midst of it, and also made a wine-press therein; and he looked that it should bring forth grapes, and it brought forth wild grapes.

children.name: bull
children.sourceText: Thy sons have fainted, save these two; they lie at the head of all the streets; as a wild bull in a net, they are full of the fury of the Lord, the rebuke of thy God.

children.name: burden
children.sourceText: For thou hast broken the yoke of his burden, and the staff of his shoulder, the rod of his oppressor.

children.name: burial
children.sourceText: Thou shalt not be joined with them in burial, because thou hast destroyed thy land and slain thy people; the seed of evil-doers shall never be renowned.

children.name: burn
children.sourceText: And the light of Israel shall be for a fire, and his Holy One for a flame, and shall burn and shall devour his thorns and his briers in one day; And shall consume the glory of his forest, and of his fruitful field, both soul and body; and they shall be as when a standard-bearer fainteth.

children.name: burneth
children.sourceText: For wickedness burneth as the fire; it shall devour the briers and thorns, and shall kindle in the thickets of the forests, and they shall mount up like the lifting up of smoke.

children.name: burning
children.sourceText: And it shall come to pass, instead of sweet smell there shall be stink; and instead of a girdle, a rent; and instead of well set hair, baldness; and instead of a stomacher, a girding of sackcloth; burning instead of beauty.

children.name: bushes
children.sourceText: And they shall come, and shall rest all of them in the desolate valleys, and in the holes of the rocks, and upon all thorns, and upon all bushes.

children.name: butter
children.sourceText: Butter and honey shall he eat, that he may know to refuse the evil and to choose the good.

children.name: buy
children.sourceText: It shall be at an instant, suddenly, Come unto me all ye ends of the earth, buy milk and honey, without money and without price.

children.name: calf
children.sourceText: The wolf also shall dwell with the lamb, and the leopard shall lie down with the kid, and the calf and the young lion and fatling together; and a little child shall lead them.

children.name: call
children.sourceText: Nevertheless, they call themselves of the holy city, but they do not stay themselves upon the God of Israel, who is the Lord of Hosts; yea, the Lord of Hosts is his name.

children.name: called
children.sourceText: Hearken and hear this, O house of Jacob, who are called by the name of Israel, and are come forth out of the waters of Judah, or out of the waters of baptism, who swear by the name of the Lord, and make mention of the God of Israel, yet they swear not in truth nor in righteousness.

children.name: Calno
children.sourceText: Is not Calno as Carchemish?

children.name: came
children.sourceText: Wherefore, when I came, there was no man; when I called, yea, there was none to answer.

children.name: cannot
children.sourceText: O house of Israel, is my hand shortened at all that it cannot redeem, or have I no power to deliver?

children.name: captain
children.sourceText: For behold, the Lord, the Lord of Hosts, doth take away from Jerusalem, and from Judah, the stay and the staff, the whole staff of bread, and the whole stay of water; The mighty man, and the man of war, the judge, and the prophet, and the prudent, and the ancient; The captain of fifty, and the honorable man, and the counselor, and the cunning artificer, and the eloquent orator.

children.name: captive
children.sourceText: Who hath begotten me these, seeing I have lost my children, and am desolate, a captive, and removing to and fro?

children.name: captives
children.sourceText: For shall the prey be taken from the mighty, or the lawful captives delivered?

children.name: captivity
children.sourceText: Therefore, my people are gone into captivity, because they have no knowledge; and their honorable men are famished, and their multitude dried up with thirst.

children.name: carbuncles
children.sourceText: And I will make thy windows of agates, and thy gates of carbuncles, and all thy borders of pleasant stones.

children.name: carcass
children.sourceText: But thou art cast out of thy grave like an abominable branch, and the remnant of those that are slain, thrust through with a sword, that go down to the stones of the pit; as a carcass trodden under feet.

children.name: carcasses
children.sourceText: Therefore, is the anger of the Lord kindled against his people, and he hath stretched forth his hand against them, and hath smitten them; and the hills did tremble, and their carcasses were torn in the midst of the streets.

children.name: Carchemish
children.sourceText: Is not Calno as Carchemish?

children.name: carriages
children.sourceText: He is come to Aiath, he is passed to Migron; at Michmash he hath laid up his carriages.

children.name: carried
children.sourceText: Behold, I will lift up mine hand to the Gentiles, and set up my standard to the people; and they shall bring thy sons in their arms, and thy daughters shall be carried upon their shoulders.

children.name: carry
children.sourceText: They shall roar like young lions; yea, they shall roar, and lay hold of the prey, and shall carry away safe, and none shall deliver.

children.name: cart
children.sourceText: Wo unto them that draw iniquity with cords of vanity, and sin as it were with a cart rope; That say:

children.name: cast
children.sourceText: Have I put thee away, or have I cast thee off forever?

children.name: cattle
children.sourceText: And all hills that shall be digged with the mattock, there shall not come thither the fear of briers and thorns; but it shall be for the sending forth of oxen, and the treading of lesser cattle.

children.name: cauls
children.sourceText: In that day the Lord will take away the bravery of their tinkling ornaments, and cauls, and round tires like the moon; The chains and the bracelets, and the mufflers; The bonnets, and the ornaments of the legs, and the headbands, and the tablets, and the ear-rings; The rings, and nose jewels; The changeable suits of apparel, and the mantles, and the wimples, and the crisping-pins; The glasses, and the fine linen, and hoods, and the veils.

children.name: cause
children.sourceText: In an acceptable time have I heard thee, O isles of the sea, and in a day of salvation have I helped thee; and I will preserve thee, and give thee my servant for a covenant of the people, to establish the earth, to cause to inherit the desolate heritages; That thou mayest say to the prisoners:

children.name: caused
children.sourceText: And they thirsted not; he led them through the deserts; he caused the waters to flow out of the rock for them; he clave the rock also and the waters gushed out.

children.name: caves
children.sourceText: And they shall go into the holes of the rocks, and into the caves of the earth, for the fear of the Lord shall come upon them and the glory of his majesty shall smite them, when he ariseth to shake terribly the earth.

children.name: cease
children.sourceText: Cease ye from man, whose breath is in his nostrils; for wherein is he to be accounted of?

children.name: ceased
children.sourceText: How hath the oppressor ceased, the golden city ceased!

children.name: cedars
children.sourceText: Yea, and the day of the Lord shall come upon all the cedars of Lebanon, for they are high and lifted up; and upon all the oaks of Bashan; And upon all the high mountains, and upon all the hills, and upon all the nations which are lifted up, and upon every people; And upon every high tower, and upon every fenced wall; And upon all the ships of the sea, and upon all the ships of Tarshish, and upon all pleasant pictures.

children.name: chaff
children.sourceText: Therefore, as the fire devoureth the stubble, and the flame consumeth the chaff, their root shall be rottenness, and their blossoms shall go up as dust; because they have cast away the law of the Lord of Hosts, and despised the word of the Holy One of Israel.

children.name: chains
children.sourceText: In that day the Lord will take away the bravery of their tinkling ornaments, and cauls, and round tires like the moon; The chains and the bracelets, and the mufflers; The bonnets, and the ornaments of the legs, and the headbands, and the tablets, and the ear-rings; The rings, and nose jewels; The changeable suits of apparel, and the mantles, and the wimples, and the crisping-pins; The glasses, and the fine linen, and hoods, and the veils.

children.name: Chaldeans
children.sourceText: The Lord hath loved him; yea, and he will fulfil his word which he hath declared by them; and he will do his pleasure on Babylon, and his arm shall come upon the Chaldeans.

children.name: Chaldees'
children.sourceText: And Babylon, the glory of kingdoms, the beauty of the Chaldees' excellency, shall be as when God overthrew Sodom and Gomorrah.

children.name: change
children.sourceText: The bricks are fallen down, but we will build with hewn stones; the sycamores are cut down, but we will change them into cedars.

children.name: channels
children.sourceText: Forasmuch as this people refuseth the waters of Shiloah that go softly, and rejoice in Rezin and Remaliah's son; Now therefore, behold, the Lord bringeth up upon them the waters of the river, strong and many, even the king of Assyria and all his glory; and he shall come up over all his channels, and go over all his banks.

children.name: charge
children.sourceText: I will send him against a hypocritical nation, and against the people of my wrath will I give him a charge to take the spoil, and to take the prey, and to tread them down like the mire of the streets.

children.name: chariots
children.sourceText: Their land also is full of silver and gold, neither is there any end of their treasures; their land is also full of horses, neither is there any end of their chariots.

children.name: chased
children.sourceText: And it shall be as the chased roe, and as a sheep that no man taketh up; and they shall every man turn to his own people, and flee every one into his own land.

children.name: chastisement
children.sourceText: But he was wounded for our transgressions, he was bruised for our iniquities; the chastisement of our peace was upon him; and with his stripes we are healed.

children.name: cheeks
children.sourceText: I gave my back to the smiter, and my cheeks to them that plucked off the hair.

children.name: chief
children.sourceText: Hell from beneath is moved for thee to meet thee at thy coming; it stirreth up the dead for thee, even all the chief ones of the earth; it hath raised up from their thrones all the kings of the nations.

children.name: child
children.sourceText: For can a woman forget her sucking child, that she should not have compassion on the son of her womb?

children.name: children
children.sourceText: Thy children shall make haste against thy destroyers; and they that made thee waste shall go forth of thee.

children.name: choose
children.sourceText: Butter and honey shall he eat, that he may know to refuse the evil and to choose the good.

children.name: chosen
children.sourceText: For, behold, I have refined thee, I have chosen thee in the furnace of affliction.

children.name: cities
children.sourceText: In mine ears, said the Lord of Hosts, of a truth many houses shall be desolate, and great and fair cities without inhabitant.

children.name: city
children.sourceText: Nevertheless, they call themselves of the holy city, but they do not stay themselves upon the God of Israel, who is the Lord of Hosts; yea, the Lord of Hosts is his name.

children.name: clave
children.sourceText: And they thirsted not; he led them through the deserts; he caused the waters to flow out of the rock for them; he clave the rock also and the waters gushed out.

children.name: clay
children.sourceText: Surely, your turning of things upside down shall be esteemed as the potter's clay.

children.name: clean
children.sourceText: Depart ye, depart ye, go ye out from thence, touch not that which is unclean; go ye out of the midst of her; be ye clean that bear the vessels of the Lord.

children.name: cleave
children.sourceText: For the Lord will have mercy on Jacob, and will yet choose Israel, and set them in their own land; and the strangers shall be joined with them, and they shall cleave to the house of Jacob.

children.name: clefts
children.sourceText: In that day a man shall cast his idols of silver, and his idols of gold, which he hath made for himself to worship, to the moles and to the bats; To go into the clefts of the rocks, and into the tops of the ragged rocks, for the fear of the Lord shall come upon them and the majesty of his glory shall smite them, when he ariseth to shake terribly the earth.

children.name: clothe
children.sourceText: And as I live, saith the Lord, thou shalt surely clothe thee with them all, as with an ornament, and bind them on even as a bride.

children.name: clothing
children.sourceText: Thou hast clothing, be thou our ruler, and let not this ruin come under thy hand; In that day shall he swear, saying:

children.name: cloud
children.sourceText: And the Lord will create upon every dwelling-place of mount Zion, and upon her assemblies, a cloud and smoke by day and the shining of a flaming fire by night; for upon all the glory of Zion shall be a defence.

children.name: clouds
children.sourceText: And now go to; I will tell you what I will do to my vineyard; I will take away the hedge thereof, and it shall be eaten up; and I will break down the wall thereof, and it shall be trodden down; And I will lay it waste; it shall not be pruned nor digged; but there shall come up briers and thorns; I will also command the clouds that they rain no rain upon it.

children.name: coal
children.sourceText: Then flew one of the seraphim unto me, having a live coal in his hand, which he had taken with the tongs from off the altar; And he laid it upon my mouth, and said:

children.name: coals
children.sourceText: Behold, I have created the smith that bloweth the coals in the fire, and that bringeth forth an instrument for his work; and I have created the waster to destroy.

children.name: cockatrice
children.sourceText: Rejoice not thou, whole Palestina, because the rod of him that smote thee is broken; for out of the serpent's root shall come forth a cockatrice, and his fruit shall be a fiery flying serpent.

children.name: cockatrice's
children.sourceText: And the sucking child shall play on the hole of the asp, and the weaned child shall put his hand on the cockatrice's den.

children.name: colors
children.sourceText: Behold, I will lay thy stones with fair colors, and lay thy foundations with sapphires.

children.name: comeliness
children.sourceText: For he shall grow up before him as a tender plant, and as a root out of dry ground; he hath no form nor comeliness; and when we shall see him there is no beauty that we should desire him.

children.name: cometh
children.sourceText: For the day of the Lord of Hosts soon cometh upon all nations, yea, upon every one; yea, upon the proud and lofty, and upon every one who is lifted up, and he shall be brought low.

children.name: comfort
children.sourceText: For the Lord shall comfort Zion, he will comfort all her waste places; and he will make her wilderness like Eden, and her desert like the garden of the Lord.

children.name: comforted
children.sourceText: Sing, O heavens; and be joyful, O earth; for the feet of those who are in the east shall be established; and break forth into singing, O mountains; for they shall be smitten no more; for the Lord hath comforted his people, and will have mercy upon his afflicted.

children.name: comfortedst
children.sourceText: O Lord, I will praise thee; though thou wast angry with me thine anger is turned away, and thou comfortedst me.

children.name: comforteth
children.sourceText: I am he; yea, I am he that comforteth you.

children.name: coming
children.sourceText: Hell from beneath is moved for thee to meet thee at thy coming; it stirreth up the dead for thee, even all the chief ones of the earth; it hath raised up from their thrones all the kings of the nations.

children.name: command
children.sourceText: And now go to; I will tell you what I will do to my vineyard; I will take away the hedge thereof, and it shall be eaten up; and I will break down the wall thereof, and it shall be trodden down; And I will lay it waste; it shall not be pruned nor digged; but there shall come up briers and thorns; I will also command the clouds that they rain no rain upon it.

children.name: commanded
children.sourceText: And I did it because I knew that thou art obstinate, and thy neck is an iron sinew, and thy brow brass; And I have even from the beginning declared to thee; before it came to pass I showed them thee; and I showed them for fear lest thou shouldst say, Mine idol hath done them, and my graven image, and my molten image hath commanded them.

children.name: commandments
children.sourceText: O that thou hadst hearkened to my commandments, then had thy peace been as a river, and thy righteousness as the waves of the sea.

children.name: compass
children.sourceText: Behold all ye that kindle fire, that compass yourselves about with sparks, walk in the light of your fire and in the sparks which ye have kindled.

children.name: compassion
children.sourceText: For can a woman forget her sucking child, that she should not have compassion on the son of her womb?

children.name: conceive
children.sourceText: Therefore, the Lord himself shall give you a sign, Behold, a virgin shall conceive, and shall bear a son, and shall call his name Immanuel.

children.name: conceived
children.sourceText: And I went unto the prophetess; and she conceived and bare a son.

children.name: condemn
children.sourceText: And all they who shall condemn me, behold, all they shall wax old as a garment, and the moth shall eat them up.

children.name: conduit
children.sourceText: Go forth now to meet Ahaz, thou and Shearjashub thy son, at the end of the conduit of the upper pool in the highway of the fuller's field; And say unto him:

children.name: confederacy
children.sourceText: Say ye not, A confederacy, to all to whom this people shall say, A confederacy; neither fear ye their fear, nor be afraid.

children.name: confounded
children.sourceText: For the Lord God will help me, therefore shall I not be confounded.

children.name: congregation
children.sourceText: I will ascend into heaven, I will exalt my throne above the stars of God; I will sit also upon the mount of the congregation, in the sides of the north; I will ascend above the heights of the clouds; I will be like the Most High.

children.name: consider
children.sourceText: And the harp, and the viol, the tabret, and pipe, and wine are in their feasts; but they regard not the work of the Lord, neither consider the operation of his hands.

children.name: constellations
children.sourceText: For the stars of heaven and the constellations thereof shall not give their light; the sun shall be darkened in his going forth, and the moon shall not cause her light to shine.

children.name: consume
children.sourceText: In the same day shall the Lord shave with a razor that is hired, by them beyond the river, by the king of Assyria, the head, and the hair of the feet; and it shall also consume the beard.

children.name: consumed
children.sourceText: For assuredly as the Lord liveth they shall see that the terrible one is brought to naught, and the scorner is consumed, and all that watch for iniquity are cut off; And they that make a man an offender for a word, and lay a snare for him that reproveth in the gate, and turn aside the just for a thing of naught.

children.name: consumeth
children.sourceText: Therefore, as the fire devoureth the stubble, and the flame consumeth the chaff, their root shall be rottenness, and their blossoms shall go up as dust; because they have cast away the law of the Lord of Hosts, and despised the word of the Holy One of Israel.

children.name: consumption
children.sourceText: For though thy people Israel be as the sand of the sea, yet a remnant of them shall return; the consumption decreed shall overflow with righteousness.

children.name: contend
children.sourceText: But thus saith the Lord, even the captives of the mighty shall be taken away, and the prey of the terrible shall be delivered; for I will contend with him that contendeth with thee, and I will save thy children.

children.name: contendeth
children.sourceText: But thus saith the Lord, even the captives of the mighty shall be taken away, and the prey of the terrible shall be delivered; for I will contend with him that contendeth with thee, and I will save thy children.

children.name: continue
children.sourceText: Wo unto them that rise up early in the morning, that they may follow strong drink, that continue until night, and wine inflame them!

children.name: converted
children.sourceText: Make the heart of this people fat, and make their ears heavy, and shut their eyes, lest they see with their eyes, and hear with their ears, and understand with their heart, and be converted and be healed.

children.name: cords
children.sourceText: Wo unto them that draw iniquity with cords of vanity, and sin as it were with a cart rope; That say:

children.name: corners
children.sourceText: And he shall set up an ensign for the nations, and shall assemble the outcasts of Israel, and gather together the dispersed of Judah from the four corners of the earth.

children.name: counsel
children.sourceText: Let him make speed, hasten his work, that we may see it; and let the counsel of the Holy One of Israel draw nigh and come, that we may know it.

children.name: counselor
children.sourceText: For behold, the Lord, the Lord of Hosts, doth take away from Jerusalem, and from Judah, the stay and the staff, the whole staff of bread, and the whole stay of water; The mighty man, and the man of war, the judge, and the prophet, and the prudent, and the ancient; The captain of fifty, and the honorable man, and the counselor, and the cunning artificer, and the eloquent orator.

children.name: counted
children.sourceText: None shall slumber nor sleep; neither shall the girdle of their loins be loosed, nor the latchet of their shoes be broken; Whose arrows shall be sharp, and all their bows bent, and their horses' hoofs shall be counted like flint, and their wheels like a whirlwind, their roaring like a lion.

children.name: countenance
children.sourceText: The show of their countenance doth witness against them, and doth declare their sin to be even as Sodom, and they cannot hide it.

children.name: countries
children.sourceText: Associate yourselves, O ye people, and ye shall be broken in pieces; and give ear all ye of far countries; gird yourselves, and ye shall be broken in pieces; gird yourselves, and ye shall be broken in pieces.

children.name: country
children.sourceText: They come from a far country, from the end of heaven, yea, the Lord, and the weapons of his indignation, to destroy the whole land.

children.name: covenant
children.sourceText: In an acceptable time have I heard thee, O isles of the sea, and in a day of salvation have I helped thee; and I will preserve thee, and give thee my servant for a covenant of the people, to establish the earth, to cause to inherit the desolate heritages; That thou mayest say to the prisoners:

children.name: cover
children.sourceText: They shall not hurt nor destroy in all my holy mountain, for the earth shall be full of the knowledge of the Lord, as the waters cover the sea.

children.name: covered
children.sourceText: And I have put my words in thy mouth, and have covered thee in the shadow of mine hand, that I may plant the heavens and lay the foundations of the earth, and say unto Zion:

children.name: covering
children.sourceText: I clothe the heavens with blackness, and I make sackcloth their covering.

children.name: cow
children.sourceText: And it shall come to pass in that day, a man shall nourish a young cow and two sheep; And it shall come to pass, for the abundance of milk they shall give he shall eat butter; for butter and honey shall every one eat that is left in the land.

children.name: create
children.sourceText: And the Lord will create upon every dwelling-place of mount Zion, and upon her assemblies, a cloud and smoke by day and the shining of a flaming fire by night; for upon all the glory of Zion shall be a defence.

children.name: created
children.sourceText: They are created now, and not from the beginning, even before the day when thou heardest them not they were declared unto thee, lest thou shouldst say, Behold I knew them.

children.name: creatures
children.sourceText: But wild beasts of the desert shall lie there; and their houses shall be full of doleful creatures; and owls shall dwell there, and satyrs shall dance there.

children.name: creditors
children.sourceText: To whom have I put thee away, or to which of my creditors have I sold you?

children.name: cried
children.sourceText: And one cried unto another, and said:

children.name: crisping-pins
children.sourceText: In that day the Lord will take away the bravery of their tinkling ornaments, and cauls, and round tires like the moon; The chains and the bracelets, and the mufflers; The bonnets, and the ornaments of the legs, and the headbands, and the tablets, and the ear-rings; The rings, and nose jewels; The changeable suits of apparel, and the mantles, and the wimples, and the crisping-pins; The glasses, and the fine linen, and hoods, and the veils.

children.name: crown
children.sourceText: Because the daughters of Zion are haughty, and walk with stretched-forth necks and wanton eyes, walking and mincing as they go, and making a tinkling with their feet, Therefore the Lord will smite with a scab the crown of the head of the daughters of Zion, and the Lord will discover their secret parts.

children.name: cry
children.sourceText: For the vineyard of the Lord of Hosts is the house of Israel, and the men of Judah his pleasant plant; and he looked for judgment, and behold, oppression; for righteousness, but behold, a cry.

children.name: cup
children.sourceText: Awake, awake, stand up, O Jerusalem, which hast drunk at the hand of the Lord the cup of his fury, thou hast drunken the dregs of the cup of trembling wrung out, And none to guide her among all the sons she hath brought forth; neither that taketh her by the hand, of all the sons she hath brought up.

children.name: curse
children.sourceText: And they shall pass through it hardly bestead and hungry; and it shall come to pass that when they shall be hungry, they shall fret themselves, and curse their king and their God, and look upward.

children.name: curtains
children.sourceText: Enlarge the place of thy tent, and let them stretch forth the curtains of thy habitations; spare not, lengthen thy cords and strengthen thy stakes; For thou shalt break forth on the right hand and on the left, and thy seed shall inherit the Gentiles and make the desolate cities to be inhabited.

children.name: cush
children.sourceText: And it shall come to pass in that day that the Lord shall set his hand again the second time to recover the remnant of his people which shall be left, from Assyria, and from Egypt, and from Pathros, and from Cush, and from Elam, and from Shinar, and from Hamath, and from the islands of the sea.

children.name: cut
children.sourceText: Nevertheless, for my name's sake will I defer mine anger, and for my praise will I refrain from thee, that I cut thee not off.

children.name: damascus
children.sourceText: For the head of Syria is Damascus, and the head of Damascus, Rezin; and within threescore and five years shall Ephraim be broken that it be not a people.

children.name: dance
children.sourceText: But wild beasts of the desert shall lie there; and their houses shall be full of doleful creatures; and owls shall dwell there, and satyrs shall dance there.

children.name: darkened
children.sourceText: And in that day they shall roar against them like the roaring of the sea; and if they look unto the land, behold, darkness and sorrow, and the light is darkened in the heavens thereof.

children.name: darkness
children.sourceText: Go forth; to them that sit in darkness:

children.name: dash
children.sourceText: Their bows shall also dash the young men to pieces; and they shall have no pity on the fruit of the womb; their eyes shall not spare children.

children.name: dashed
children.sourceText: Their children also shall be dashed to pieces before their eyes; their houses shall be spoiled and their wives ravished.

children.name: daughter
children.sourceText: Shake thyself from the dust; arise, sit down, O Jerusalem; loose thyself from the bands of thy neck, O captive daughter of Zion.

children.name: daughters
children.sourceText: Behold, I will lift up mine hand to the Gentiles, and set up my standard to the people; and they shall bring thy sons in their arms, and thy daughters shall be carried upon their shoulders.

children.name: David
children.sourceText: And it was told the house of David, saying:

children.name: day
children.sourceText: They are created now, and not from the beginning, even before the day when thou heardest them not they were declared unto thee, lest thou shouldst say, Behold I knew them.

children.name: days
children.sourceText: Put on strength, O arm of the Lord; awake as in the ancient days.

children.name: daytime
children.sourceText: And there shall be a tabernacle for a shadow in the daytime from the heat, and for a place of refuge, and a covert from storm and from rain.

children.name: dead
children.sourceText: Seek unto them that have familiar spirits, and unto wizards that peep and mutter, should not a people seek unto their God for the living to hear from the dead?

children.name: deal
children.sourceText: Yea, and thou heardest not; yea, thou knewest not; yea, from that time thine ear was not opened; for I knew that thou wouldst deal very treacherously, and wast called a transgressor from the womb.

children.name: death
children.sourceText: The people that walked in darkness have seen a great light; they that dwell in the land of the shadow of death, upon them hath the light shined.

children.name: deceit
children.sourceText: And he made his grave with the wicked, and with the rich in his death; because he had done no evil, neither was any deceit in his mouth.

children.name: declare
children.sourceText: Thou hast seen and heard all this; and will ye not declare them?

children.name: declared
children.sourceText: Behold, I have declared the former things from the beginning; and they went forth out of my mouth, and I showed them.

children.name: decree
children.sourceText: Wo unto them that decree unrighteous decrees, and that write grievousness which they have prescribed; To turn away the needy from judgment, and to take away the right from the poor of my people, that widows may be their prey, and that they may rob the fatherless!

children.name: decreed
children.sourceText: For though thy people Israel be as the sand of the sea, yet a remnant of them shall return; the consumption decreed shall overflow with righteousness.

children.name: decrees
children.sourceText: Wo unto them that decree unrighteous decrees, and that write grievousness which they have prescribed; To turn away the needy from judgment, and to take away the right from the poor of my people, that widows may be their prey, and that they may rob the fatherless!

children.name: defence
children.sourceText: And the Lord will create upon every dwelling-place of mount Zion, and upon her assemblies, a cloud and smoke by day and the shining of a flaming fire by night; for upon all the glory of Zion shall be a defence.

children.name: defer
children.sourceText: Nevertheless, for my name's sake will I defer mine anger, and for my praise will I refrain from thee, that I cut thee not off.

children.name: delight
children.sourceText: Behold, I will stir up the Medes against them, which shall not regard silver and gold, nor shall they delight in it.

children.name: deliver
children.sourceText: Even the captives of the mighty shall be taken away, and the prey of the terrible shall be delivered; for the Mighty God shall deliver his covenant people.

children.name: delivered
children.sourceText: For shall the prey be taken from the mighty, or the lawful captives delivered?

children.name: den
children.sourceText: And the sucking child shall play on the hole of the asp, and the weaned child shall put his hand on the cockatrice's den.

children.name: depart
children.sourceText: The envy of Ephraim also shall depart, and the adversaries of Judah shall be cut off; Ephraim shall not envy Judah, and Judah shall not vex Ephraim.

children.name: departed
children.sourceText: The Lord shall bring upon thee, and upon thy people, and upon thy father's house, days that have not come from the day that Ephraim departed from Judah, the king of Assyria.

children.name: depths
children.sourceText: Art thou not he who hath dried the sea, the waters of the great deep; that hath made the depths of the sea a way for the ransomed to pass over?

children.name: descend
children.sourceText: Therefore, hell hath enlarged herself, and opened her mouth without measure; and their glory, and their multitude, and their pomp, and he that rejoiceth, shall descend into it.

children.name: desert
children.sourceText: For the Lord shall comfort Zion, he will comfort all her waste places; and he will make her wilderness like Eden, and her desert like the garden of the Lord.

children.name: deserts
children.sourceText: And they thirsted not; he led them through the deserts; he caused the waters to flow out of the rock for them; he clave the rock also and the waters gushed out.

children.name: desire
children.sourceText: For he shall grow up before him as a tender plant, and as a root out of dry ground; he hath no form nor comeliness; and when we shall see him there is no beauty that we should desire him.

children.name: Desolation
children.sourceText: These two sons are come unto thee, who shall be sorry for thee, thy desolation and destruction, and the famine and the sword, and by whom shall I comfort thee?

children.name: despised
children.sourceText: Therefore, as the fire devoureth the stubble, and the flame consumeth the chaff, their root shall be rottenness, and their blossoms shall go up as dust; because they have cast away the law of the Lord of Hosts, and despised the word of the Holy One of Israel.

children.name: despiseth
children.sourceText: Thus saith the Lord, the Redeemer of Israel, his Holy One, to him whom man despiseth, to him whom the nations abhorreth, to servant of rulers:

children.name: destroy
children.sourceText: And forgettest the Lord thy maker, that hath stretched forth the heavens, and laid the foundations of the earth, and hast feared continually every day, because of the fury of the oppressor, as if he were ready to destroy?

children.name: destroyed
children.sourceText: Thy seed also had been as the sand; the offspring of thy bowels like the gravel thereof; his name should not have been cut off nor destroyed from before me.

children.name: destroyers
children.sourceText: Thy children shall make haste against thy destroyers; and they that made thee waste shall go forth of thee.

children.name: destruction
children.sourceText: For thy waste and thy desolate places, and the land of thy destruction, shall even now be too narrow by reason of the inhabitants; and they that swallowed thee up shall be far away.

children.name: determined
children.sourceText: For the Lord God of Hosts shall make a consumption, even determined in all the land.

children.name: devour
children.sourceText: Therefore the Lord shall set up the adversaries of Rezin against him, and join his enemies together; The Syrians before and the Philistines behind; and they shall devour Israel with open mouth.

children.name: devoureth
children.sourceText: Therefore, as the fire devoureth the stubble, and the flame consumeth the chaff, their root shall be rottenness, and their blossoms shall go up as dust; because they have cast away the law of the Lord of Hosts, and despised the word of the Holy One of Israel.

children.name: devouring
children.sourceText: And when that day shall come they shall be visited of the Lord of Hosts, with thunder and with earthquake, and with a great noise, and with storm, and with tempest, and with the flame of devouring fire.

children.name: did
children.sourceText: I did show them suddenly.

children.name: didst
children.sourceText: And that I have showed thee new things from this time, even hidden things, and thou didst not know them.

children.name: die
children.sourceText: Behold, at my rebuke I dry up the sea, I make their rivers a wilderness and their fish to stink because the waters are dried up, and they die because of thirst.

children.name: died
children.sourceText: In the year that king Uzziah died, I saw also the Lord sitting upon a throne, high and lifted up, and his train filled the temple.

children.name: digged
children.sourceText: Look unto the rock from whence ye are hewn, and to the hole of the pit from whence ye are digged.

children.name: dimness
children.sourceText: And they shall look unto the earth and behold trouble, and darkness, dimness of anguish, and shall be driven to darkness.

children.name: disannul
children.sourceText: For the Lord of Hosts hath purposed, and who shall disannul?

children.name: disciples
children.sourceText: Bind up the testimony, seal the law among my disciples.

children.name: discover
children.sourceText: Because the daughters of Zion are haughty, and walk with stretched-forth necks and wanton eyes, walking and mincing as they go, and making a tinkling with their feet, Therefore the Lord will smite with a scab the crown of the head of the daughters of Zion, and the Lord will discover their secret parts.

children.name: dispersed
children.sourceText: And he shall set up an ensign for the nations, and shall assemble the outcasts of Israel, and gather together the dispersed of Judah from the four corners of the earth.

children.name: dissolved
children.sourceText: Howl, O gate; cry, O city; thou, whole Palestina, art dissolved; for there shall come from the north a smoke, and none shall be alone in his appointed times.

children.name: distress
children.sourceText: And all the nations that fight against Zion, and that distress her, shall be as a dream of a night vision; yea, it shall be unto them, even as unto a hungry man which dreameth, and behold he eateth but he awaketh and his soul is empty; or like unto a thirsty man which dreameth, and behold he drinketh but he awaketh and behold he is faint, and his soul hath appetite; yea, even so shall the multitude of all the nations be that fight against Mount Zion.

children.name: divide
children.sourceText: Thou hast multiplied the nation, and increased the joy, they joy before thee according to the joy in harvest, and as men rejoice when they divide the spoil.

children.name: divorcement
children.sourceText: Where is the bill of your mother's divorcement?

children.name: do
children.sourceText: Nevertheless, they call themselves of the holy city, but they do not stay themselves upon the God of Israel, who is the Lord of Hosts; yea, the Lord of Hosts is his name.

children.name: doctrine
children.sourceText: They also that erred in spirit shall come to understanding, and they that murmured shall learn doctrine.

children.name: doeth
children.sourceText: For behold, all ye that doeth iniquity, stay yourselves and wonder, for ye shall cry out, and cry; yea, ye shall be drunken but not with wine, ye shall stagger but not with strong drink.

children.name: doings
children.sourceText: For Jerusalem is ruined, and Judah is fallen, because their tongues and their doings have been against the Lord, to provoke the eyes of his glory.

children.name: done
children.sourceText: And I did it because I knew that thou art obstinate, and thy neck is an iron sinew, and thy brow brass; And I have even from the beginning declared to thee; before it came to pass I showed them thee; and I showed them for fear lest thou shouldst say, Mine idol hath done them, and my graven image, and my molten image hath commanded them.

children.name: door
children.sourceText: And the posts of the door moved at the voice of him that cried, and the house was filled with smoke.

children.name: doth
children.sourceText: For behold, the Lord, the Lord of Hosts, doth take away from Jerusalem, and from Judah, the stay and the staff, the whole staff of bread, and the whole stay of water; The mighty man, and the man of war, the judge, and the prophet, and the prudent, and the ancient; The captain of fifty, and the honorable man, and the counselor, and the cunning artificer, and the eloquent orator.

children.name: dragon
children.sourceText: Art thou not he that hath cut Rahab, and wounded the dragon?

children.name: dragons
children.sourceText: And the wild beasts of the islands shall cry in their desolate houses, and dragons in their pleasant palaces; and her time is near to come, and her day shall not be prolonged.

children.name: draw
children.sourceText: Wo unto them that draw iniquity with cords of vanity, and sin as it were with a cart rope; That say:

children.name: dread
children.sourceText: Sanctify the Lord of Hosts himself, and let him be your fear, and let him be your dread.

children.name: dream
children.sourceText: And all the nations that fight against Zion, and that distress her, shall be as a dream of a night vision; yea, it shall be unto them, even as unto a hungry man which dreameth, and behold he eateth but he awaketh and his soul is empty; or like unto a thirsty man which dreameth, and behold he drinketh but he awaketh and behold he is faint, and his soul hath appetite; yea, even so shall the multitude of all the nations be that fight against Mount Zion.

children.name: dreameth
children.sourceText: And all the nations that fight against Zion, and that distress her, shall be as a dream of a night vision; yea, it shall be unto them, even as unto a hungry man which dreameth, and behold he eateth but he awaketh and his soul is empty; or like unto a thirsty man which dreameth, and behold he drinketh but he awaketh and behold he is faint, and his soul hath appetite; yea, even so shall the multitude of all the nations be that fight against Mount Zion.

children.name: dregs
children.sourceText: Awake, awake, stand up, O Jerusalem, which hast drunk at the hand of the Lord the cup of his fury, thou hast drunken the dregs of the cup of trembling wrung out, And none to guide her among all the sons she hath brought forth; neither that taketh her by the hand, of all the sons she hath brought up.

children.name: dried
children.sourceText: Behold, at my rebuke I dry up the sea, I make their rivers a wilderness and their fish to stink because the waters are dried up, and they die because of thirst.

children.name: drink
children.sourceText: Thus saith thy Lord, the Lord and thy God pleadeth the cause of his people; behold, I have taken out of thine hand the cup of trembling, the dregs of the cup of my fury; thou shalt no more drink it again.

children.name: drinketh
children.sourceText: And all the nations that fight against Zion, and that distress her, shall be as a dream of a night vision; yea, it shall be unto them, even as unto a hungry man which dreameth, and behold he eateth but he awaketh and his soul is empty; or like unto a thirsty man which dreameth, and behold he drinketh but he awaketh and behold he is faint, and his soul hath appetite; yea, even so shall the multitude of all the nations be that fight against Mount Zion.

children.name: driven
children.sourceText: Hearken, O ye house of Israel, all ye that are broken off and are driven out because of the wickedness of the pastors of my people; yea, all ye that are broken off, that are scattered abroad, who are of my people, O house of Israel.

children.name: drunk
children.sourceText: Awake, awake, stand up, O Jerusalem, which hast drunk at the hand of the Lord the cup of his fury, thou hast drunken the dregs of the cup of trembling wrung out, And none to guide her among all the sons she hath brought forth; neither that taketh her by the hand, of all the sons she hath brought up.

children.name: drunken
children.sourceText: And I will feed them that oppress thee with their own flesh; they shall be drunken with their own blood as with sweet wine; and all flesh shall know that I, the Lord, am thy Savior and thy Redeemer, the Mighty One of Jacob.

children.name: dust
children.sourceText: And kings shall be thy nursing fathers, and their queens thy nursing mothers; they shall bow down to thee with their face towards the earth, and lick up the dust of thy feet; and thou shalt know that I am the Lord; for they shall not be ashamed that wait for me.

children.name: dwell
children.sourceText: The place is too strait for me; give place to me that I may dwell.

children.name: dwellest
children.sourceText: O my people that dwellest in Zion, be not afraid of the Assyrian; he shall smite thee with a rod, and shall lift up his staff against thee, after the manner of Egypt.

children.name: dwelleth
children.sourceText: Behold, I and the children whom the Lord hath given me are for signs and for wonders in Israel from the Lord of Hosts, which dwelleth in Mount Zion.

children.name: dwelling-place
children.sourceText: And the Lord will create upon every dwelling-place of mount Zion, and upon her assemblies, a cloud and smoke by day and the shining of a flaming fire by night; for upon all the glory of Zion shall be a defence.

children.name: dwelt
children.sourceText: It shall never be inhabited, neither shall it be dwelt in from generation to generation:

children.name: ear
children.sourceText: Yea, and thou heardest not; yea, thou knewest not; yea, from that time thine ear was not opened; for I knew that thou wouldst deal very treacherously, and wast called a transgressor from the womb.

children.name: ear-rings
children.sourceText: In that day the Lord will take away the bravery of their tinkling ornaments, and cauls, and round tires like the moon; The chains and the bracelets, and the mufflers; The bonnets, and the ornaments of the legs, and the headbands, and the tablets, and the ear-rings; The rings, and nose jewels; The changeable suits of apparel, and the mantles, and the wimples, and the crisping-pins; The glasses, and the fine linen, and hoods, and the veils.

children.name: ears
children.sourceText: The children whom thou shalt have, after thou hast lost the first, shall again in thine ears say:

children.name: earth
children.sourceText: Mine hand hath also laid the foundation of the earth, and my right hand hath spanned the heavens.

children.name: earthquake
children.sourceText: And when that day shall come they shall be visited of the Lord of Hosts, with thunder and with earthquake, and with a great noise, and with storm, and with tempest, and with the flame of devouring fire.

children.name: eat
children.sourceText: And all they who shall condemn me, behold, all they shall wax old as a garment, and the moth shall eat them up.

children.name: eaten
children.sourceText: The Lord will enter into judgment with the ancients of his people and the princes thereof; for ye have eaten up the vineyard and the spoil of the poor in your houses.

children.name: eateth
children.sourceText: And all the nations that fight against Zion, and that distress her, shall be as a dream of a night vision; yea, it shall be unto them, even as unto a hungry man which dreameth, and behold he eateth but he awaketh and his soul is empty; or like unto a thirsty man which dreameth, and behold he drinketh but he awaketh and behold he is faint, and his soul hath appetite; yea, even so shall the multitude of all the nations be that fight against Mount Zion.

children.name: eden
children.sourceText: For the Lord shall comfort Zion, he will comfort all her waste places; and he will make her wilderness like Eden, and her desert like the garden of the Lord.

children.name: Edom
children.sourceText: But they shall fly upon the shoulders of the Philistines towards the west; they shall spoil them of the east together; they shall lay their hand upon Edom and Moab; and the children of Ammon shall obey them.

children.name: eggs
children.sourceText: By the strength of my hand and by my wisdom I have done these things; for I am prudent; and I have moved the borders of the people, and have robbed their treasures, and I have put down the inhabitants like a valiant man; And my hand hath found as a nest the riches of the people; and as one gathereth eggs that are left have I gathered all the earth; and there was none that moved the wing, or opened the mouth, or peeped.

children.name: Egypt
children.sourceText: And it shall come to pass in that day that the Lord shall hiss for the fly that is in the uttermost part of Egypt, and for the bee that is in the land of Assyria.

children.name: Egyptian
children.sourceText: And the Lord shall utterly destroy the tongue of the Egyptian sea; and with his mighty wind he shall shake his hand over the river, and shall smite it in the seven streams, and make men go over dry shod.

children.name: Elam
children.sourceText: And it shall come to pass in that day that the Lord shall set his hand again the second time to recover the remnant of his people which shall be left, from Assyria, and from Egypt, and from Pathros, and from Cush, and from Elam, and from Shinar, and from Hamath, and from the islands of the sea.

children.name: end
children.sourceText: Go ye forth of Babylon, flee ye from the Chaldeans, with a voice of singing declare ye, tell this, utter to the end of the earth; say ye:

children.name: ends
children.sourceText: I will also give thee for a light to the Gentiles, that thou mayest be my salvation unto the ends of the earth.

children.name: enemies
children.sourceText: Therefore the Lord shall set up the adversaries of Rezin against him, and join his enemies together; The Syrians before and the Philistines behind; and they shall devour Israel with open mouth.

children.name: enlarge
children.sourceText: Enlarge the place of thy tent, and let them stretch forth the curtains of thy habitations; spare not, lengthen thy cords and strengthen thy stakes; For thou shalt break forth on the right hand and on the left, and thy seed shall inherit the Gentiles and make the desolate cities to be inhabited.

children.name: enlarged
children.sourceText: Therefore, hell hath enlarged herself, and opened her mouth without measure; and their glory, and their multitude, and their pomp, and he that rejoiceth, shall descend into it.

children.name: ensign
children.sourceText: And he will lift up an ensign to the nations from far, and will hiss unto them from the end of the earth; and behold, they shall come with speed swiftly; none shall be weary nor stumble among them.

children.name: enter
children.sourceText: O ye wicked ones, enter into the rock, and hide thee in the dust, for the fear of the Lord and the glory of his majesty shall smite thee.

children.name: envy
children.sourceText: The envy of Ephraim also shall depart, and the adversaries of Judah shall be cut off; Ephraim shall not envy Judah, and Judah shall not vex Ephraim.

children.name: Ephah
children.sourceText: Yea, ten acres of vineyard shall yield one bath, and the seed of a homer shall yield an ephah.

children.name: Ephraim
children.sourceText: Syria is confederate with Ephraim.

children.name: equity
